    • Constructor Detail

      • Knight

        public Knight(java.lang.String color,
              Chessboard board,
              int row,
              int column)
        Knight constructor

        The constructor for Knight calls the ChessPiece super constructor.

        Parameters:
        color - Description: The color of the Knight. Can be w or b for white and black.
        board - Description: The chessboard the Knight is located in.
        row - Description: The row the Knight starts on in the chessboard.
        column - Description: The column the Knight starts on in the chessboard.

    • Method Detail

      • isValidSquare

        public boolean isValidSquare(int row,
                             int column)
        Checks to see if the given square is valid to move onto.

        This function checks to see whether it is a valid move to move onto the square with the given row and column. It is valid if it is empty or if there is a piece of the opposite color there, which the Knight can capture.

        The move is invalid if the move takes the Knight outside the board (row or column greater than 8 or less than 0) and if there is another piece of the same color on that square.

        Parameters:
        row - Description: The row of the square being checked for whether it is valid to move onto.
        column - Description: The column of the square being checked for whether it is valid to move onto.
        Returns:
        Description: Returns true if the Knight can move onto the given square and false otherwise.

      • getAvailableMoves

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getAvailableMoves()
        Gets all available moves for the Knight.

        Calls the isValidSquare function for the squares that a knight can move to: 2 rows up and 1 column to the left, 1 row up and 2 columns to the left, 1 row down and 2 columns to the left, 2 rows down and 1 column to the left, 2 rows down and 1 column to the right, 1 row down and 2 columns to the right, 1 row up and 2 columns to the right, and 2 rows up and 1 column to the right.

        If the isValidSquare function returns true for a given position, then that position's letter-number combination will be added to an ArrayList of all possible moves for the Knight.

        Specified by:
        getAvailableMoves in class ChessPiece
        Returns:
        Description: Returns the ArrayList of all possible moves the Knight can take.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns the String representation of this piece.

        Returns a String representation of this piece, which is its one-letter color appended by "N", representing its status as a knight.

        Specified by:
        toString in class ChessPiece
        Returns:
        Description: Returns the string representation of this piece.
